snippet: Millions of dollars in silver bullion that spent more than 70 years on the ocean floor has been hauled to the surface, with much more to come.
abstract: Forty-eight tons of silver bullion that spent more than 70 years at the bottom of the North Atlantic have been hauled to the surface and returned to the British government, its rightful owner; the silver was recovered from the Gairsoppa, which was carrying the riches to England from India in 1941 when a Nazi torpedo struck; the ship went down about 300 miles southwest of Ireland in waters 2.9 miles deep, lower than the resting place of the Titanic.
lead_paragraph: Millions of dollars in silver bullion that spent more than 70 years on the ocean floor has been hauled to the surface, with much more to come.

headline.seo: Huge Cargo of Silver Is Recovered From a Ship Sunk by Nazis
headline.main: Tons of Silver Hauled Up After Decades Undersea
headline.print_headline: Tons of Silver Hauled Up After Decades Undersea
